p: The reducing power of ferrous ions in the tested extracts is presented in Figure 4. Similar to the radical scavenging capacity, all extracts showed an increasing trend in antioxidant capacity with increasing concentrations. A significant difference in the EC 50 value between the different extracts and ascorbic acid was also observed. The FRAP capacities of the four extracts were in the order of R-AME > Ap-AME > R-AEE > Ap-AEE. The R-AME extract showed good reducing power capacity with an EC 50 value of 20.82 ± 1.14 μg/mL, which is comparable to that of ascorbic acid (13.27 ± 0.89 μg/mL).
